TopicTitle: We need to be able to change command pods on rocket!

Articles.Content:
When I build a rocket it always starts with the command pod.

But I think it should be possible in future versions of KSP to quickly change command pods on an already build and saved rocket!

For example, if I want my heavy Mun rocket to carry just a capsule or satalite for orbiting I build a rocket like that with the capsule or satalite on it. But when later I want a Mun lander on top of that rocket I should not have to build a whole new rocket but be able to swap the top, and replace the capsule or satalite for orbiting with a Mun lander for going to the Mun!

You get my drift?

What do you guys think?

My best regards, Kodiak.
That would be nice. My usual rocket is pretty simple, but I hate building it again and again every time I want to launch a new satellite or an experimental lander.
That would help but a more useful tool would be the ability to cop/paste sections. So you could simply copy everything below the capsule and paste it into a new rocket, if you wanted.

Or maybe the possibility to start building a rocket from whatever point we want? Like I want to start building a rocket at the bottom and work my way up. That way I could save every step I build, and could later on use that step on another rocket and put whatever I want at the top!

My best regards, Kodiak.

There is already a feature planned which is the saving of \'assemblies\', such as a payload or a heavy-lifter rocket, which would allow you to effectively save everything under the CM if you wanted to.
